Uses of Package
de.stock.environment

  • Packages that use de.stock.environment 
    Package Description
    de.stock.environment  
    de.stock.environment.types  
    de.stock.event  
    de.stock.tradeable  
  • Classes in de.stock.environment used by de.stock.environment 
    Class and Description
    Environment
    See IEnvironment for further information
    EnvironmentGroup
    An event can influence a single tradeable, an environment (and therefore the tradeables influenced by the environment) or an environment group which consists of multiple environments

    The difference between multiple environments and one environment group containing these environments is that all tradeables of the multiple environments are influenced and with the environment group the intersecting tradeables of the environments are influenced only

    Example:
    Environment E1 influences tradeable T1 and T2
    Environment E2 influences tradeable T2 and T3

    Event A with single environments E1 and E2 will influence T1, T2 and T3
    Event B with environment group consisting of E1 and E2 will influence T2 only as T2 is the intersecting tradeable of E1 and E2
    EnvironmentHandler
    The environment handler holds all environments as a centralized storage for those and is the single point of contact for events to influence tradeables with EnvironmentHandler.influenceEnvironments(ArrayList)
    IEnvironment
    Interface for environments

    The environment system is seperated into a three element hierarchy

    At the very top of the hierarchy is the Location
    in the middle is the Area
    and at the very bottom is the Group
    (Read class headers of those for further information)

    A environment can link to another environment if it is a part or member of it but it must be of the same type or one layer below in the hierarchy
    (See IEnvironment.linkEnvironment(IEnvironment))

    Environment developers must instantiate Area, Group or Location
    They must not instantiate Environment
  • Classes in de.stock.environment used by de.stock.environment.types
